SEARCH

Class OrderMenu

java.lang.Object
OrderMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class OrderMenu extends Object implements ActionListener
This ordering screen is where employees can order drinks off the menu. It has two main screens: the category selection and the drink selection. The category section is a grid of buttons for every unique drink category. The drink section has every option for the drinks in that category, including sugar, ice, etc. The last step is processing the checkout.
The screen is entirely modular and pulls nearly all of its data from the database.
Author:
Elliot Michlin

      private JList orderList
      The item list on the right side. Updates with each new drink being added to the order

      private JPanel jCard
      Toggles between two screens: the category selection and drink selection

    • catSelectPanel

      private JPanel catSelectPanel
      The category select screen. Has a grid of buttons that change in number dynamically with each category added.

    • drinkSelectPanel

      private JPanel drinkSelectPanel
      The drink select screen. The toppings and drink buttons dynamically change with the menu in the database

      private JLabel catTitle
      The title of the category in the drink selection menu

      The panel where drink options are added dynamically

      The panel where category options are added dynamically

      private JButton addToOrderButton
      The Add to Order + Button.

    • cancelButton

      private JButton cancelButton
      The cancel button. Goes back to the category selection screen from the drink selection screen without adding anything to the order.

    • sugarButton100

      private JRadioButton sugarButton100
      The 100% sugar button. Used to set the default option in the button group.

    • iceButton100

      private JRadioButton iceButton100
      The 100% ice button. Used to set the default option in the button group.

    • scrollPane

      private JScrollPane scrollPane
      The scroll window that stores both selection panels. This is used to access the scroll speed parameter.

    • toppingPanel

      private JPanel toppingPanel
      The panel where topping options are added dynamically

    • logoutButton

      private JButton logoutButton
      The logout button. Moves the user back to the login screen and marks them as logged out in the employee database table.

    • iceButtonGroup

      private ButtonGroup iceButtonGroup
      The group of buttons that control a drink's ice level. Used to find the currently selected ice level button and read its value.

    • drinkButtonGroup

      private ButtonGroup drinkButtonGroup
      The group of buttons that control which drink was chosen in the current category. Used to find the currently selected drink button and read its value.

    • sugarButtonGroup

      private ButtonGroup sugarButtonGroup
      The group of buttons that control a drink's sugar level. Used to find the currently selected sugar level button and read its value.

    • GRAY_GOOD

      private static final Color GRAY_GOOD
      The shade of gray used by normal buttons.

    • OUT_OF_STOCK

      private static final Color OUT_OF_STOCK
      The color used for out of stock item buttons.

    • BLUE_GOOD

      private static final Color BLUE_GOOD
      The blue color used for the checkout and add to order + buttons.

    • menu

      private Map<String,ArrayList<OrderMenu.Drink>> menu
      The menu, loaded into memory in a hashmap. The hashmap sorts the drinks by categories for easy sorting.

    • selectedCategory

      private String selectedCategory
      The currently selected category. Changes when a different category button is selected.

    • overallSubtotal

      private double overallSubtotal
      The total for the order, in millicents.

    • orderView

      private Vector<String> orderView
      The string list used by the right-side sidebar to show the currently ordered drinks with their prices.

    • drinkButtons

      private final List<JRadioButton> drinkButtons
      The array for the drink buttons. Adding the drink buttons here allows for easy removal when the category changes.

    • toppingButtons

      private final List<JRadioButton> toppingButtons
      The array for the topping buttons. Adding the topping buttons here allows for easy checking of if they're toggled on.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderMenu

      OrderMenu()
      Initializes the window by downloading the menu, placing the category buttons, and adding the two different pages (category & drink selection).

  • Method Details

    • addActionListeners

      private void addActionListeners()
      Links button presses to the actionPerformed method.
      See Also:
      • actionPerformed(ActionEvent)

    • getPanel

      public JPanel getPanel()
      Method is used to get the JPanel object
      Returns:
      JPanel object

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Runs when a button is pressed. This handles the following button events:
      • Manager Button - moves to manager dashboard
      • Category Button - opens drink ordering page with that category specifically
      • Cancel Button - cancels drink adding
      • Add To Order Button - adds drink to the order
      • Total Button - completes the transaction
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - the event to be processed
      See Also:
      • Main.changeToManagerDashboard()

    • completeTransaction

      private void completeTransaction()
      Runs SQL queries to complete the transaction and empty the cart.

    • restartTransaction

      private void restartTransaction()
      Restarts a transaction & clears the cart.

    • addToOrder

      private boolean addToOrder()
      Parses what buttons were pressed in the drink selection menu.
      The drink name is gotten from the drinkButtonGroup's currently selected button. The topping list is gotten from looping through the toppingButtons list and checking if they're toggled on. The ice and sugar buttons are hardcoded in, as there are too few and they don't change.
      Returns:
      if successfully added to order

    • createMenu

      private void createMenu()
      Downloads menu table from the database to get every menu item and every category, and then it sorts those items by the category.

    • createCategories

      private void createCategories()
      Places the category buttons at the start using the downloaded menu.

    • createToppings

      private void createToppings()
      The method creates topping buttons for the UI. It first pulls all toppings from the inventory in the database, and does math to check if they're in stock. It then creates buttons for each topping - displaying the in stock ones differently from the out of stock.

    • logout

      private void logout()
      Logs the user out and displays the login screen.
